meanings.definition: The act of coming to an end or termination.
meanings.sent1: The expiration of the movie left everyone wanting more.
meanings.sent2: The expiration of the lease meant it was time to move out.
meanings.sent3: The expiration of the game was met with cheers and applause.
meanings.sent4: The expiration of the candle marked the end of the romantic dinner.
meanings.sent5: The expiration of the concert was a bittersweet moment for the fans.

meanings.definition: The process of exhaling air from the lungs.
meanings.sent1: After a deep breath, the slow expiration helped calm her nerves.
meanings.sent2: The doctor instructed him to practice proper expiration techniques during yoga.
meanings.sent3: His loud expiration after running up the stairs made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The rhythmic sound of her expiration was soothing in the quiet room.
meanings.sent5: The sudden expiration of air from his lungs surprised everyone in the room.

meanings.definition: The date at which something, such as a contract or license, comes to an end.
meanings.sent1: She marked her calendar with the expiration date of her driver's license.
meanings.sent2: The expiration date of the coupon was fast approaching.
meanings.sent3: The expiration date of the contract was a cause for celebration.
meanings.sent4: The expiration date of the warranty meant he had to be careful with his phone.
meanings.sent5: The expiration date of the membership was a reminder to renew it soon.
